cf940598d4964ca6.voiceContent: I quite like this fountain. It's on the smaller side, but it serves its purpose well. The decorations on the side are quite lovely, too.

851e7c5b98e9b786.voiceContent: As for any shortcomings... I suppose the sections extending from the floral vault are prone to collecting dust? It must be a pain to clean them.

515167909136778f.voiceContent: They take you away you from your troubles, and you just feel so free...

9c50906de1231ca8.voiceContent: This style is one of the most widely used in Sumeru. You can see its influence on many of the Akademiya's buildings.

06dbde535589e36f.voiceContent: If I could recommend only one of Sumeru's architecture styles, this one would be it. The central, white section really brings the whole composition together.

fa8b45b6c768e0d6.voiceContent: I want to know the reasoning behind why you arranged the roads and buildings like this...

69de89b15c4e897a.voiceContent: Huh... This place sure is interesting.

66dc17cfa788de09.voiceContent: I guess what I really want to say is... I'm so grateful that you invited me here as your guest.

ee3f3824390ce725.voiceContent: Ah, sorry, I didn't mean to take the conversation to such a heavy place. Please pretend I didn't say anything.

9bad196be79e72bb.voiceContent: Can't you try, just a little? Don't let such a wondrous space go to waste.

33507e4dfddea698.voiceContent: I hated living like that, but I also had no quick way out of that situation. Every day was a struggle between my ego and my reality.

1653a77427ed7472.voiceContent: I'm an architect! I build and design things! Seeing your home devoid of anything makes me feel really... really sad.

432f1e2d533393fe.voiceContent: Although we managed to renovate the building's weathered exterior, restoring the lighthouse's heavily eroded foundation was a massive struggle... There was only so much we could do.

16c74bd0d562b9aa.voiceContent: A... whim? Wait, why would you just put things together on a whim? None of this was planned?

17ed252e57940fd0.voiceContent: Ah, I left the house in a hurry today, so I didn't bring anything with me... I'll bring you some finely ground coffee next time.

3fa32afc1c2271d8.voiceContent: Cast your troubles to the wayside, and let yourself fall into the sweet embrace of sleep. You might see things in a new light once you wake up.

86b8e73189f870c6.voiceContent: Hmph! I'm not so easily offended. Pfft.

c78fcb9db423f37b.voiceContent: Never have I seen a place where you can decorate to your heart's whimsy... You don't understand what this means to an architect like me.

7bd0c0fc66e4955a.voiceContent: It's so elaborately made, and, most importantly, each component is perfectly in its place.

ad834c12c76ae16d.voiceContent: It's not every day you come across technology like this. If it could be replicated one day for architectural projects...

8271bd1a3433f545.voiceContent: Good morning. A new day brings new tasks and responsibilities.

f208fdb52dd92484.voiceContent: I'm still getting used to it all.

a8f48df969d498ec.voiceContent: Speaking of which, can I see your gardens and ponds? Or how about your water fountains? If you don't mind, tell me what you had in mind when decorating your realm!

b90d7dd6af785b48.voiceContent: Err... That might not be the best idea...

1cf63258cc313fd0.voiceContent: Hahaha, of course! When that day does come, I won't charge you any commission fees. I'm sure your happiness alone will be more than enough for me.

93ce1a1c0a4c0302.voiceContent: I was far more idealistic during my years as a student. I hate to admit it, but... an overly naive person cannot survive in this world.

44c9aa3cee327eb6.voiceContent: My life? Hmm... There's a lot I could talk about, but I don't know where to start...

52b2a4a2cce852f1.voiceContent: Ah, I see. Taking what you've learned from your travels and applying them to your principles of design... Excellent!

d5d4df049548a75d.voiceContent: Hm, things I like... I recently bought a new coffee grinder. It's been great.

459c59a5f7561d32.voiceContent: It blows my mind... So much free space for building and designing! It's like a sketchbook that'll never run out of pages.

6b09ccf124dd9f32.voiceContent: It's probably best if I don't pick the topic of conversation. I've had people tell me that I just end up rambling on endlessly about my profession.

ed160c128e8c2fcb.voiceContent: I had a lot of pride about being a master architect, so I detested the idea of doing anything else for a living... Only later did I learn about the more difficult aspects of life.

cfcb569965c629ce.voiceContent: You have the eye for this kind of work. If the life of an architect wasn't so difficult, I'd recommend that you enroll in formal study.

aa2d38e19087185f.voiceContent: You've worked hard. Take some well-deserved rest.

9ccfaaf81b114615.voiceContent: Sure. Anything you want to talk about?

4820e9d7cb3ad52d.voiceContent: When it comes to design, placement shouldn't be arbitrary... Don't tell me, the boundless potential of this place has robbed you of your principles and pride as a creator!?

28009f1205731122.voiceContent: A little tip Take your time — everything will get done.

7f90ae0bd477a1ea.voiceContent: I want to go to the most distant point from here. With such a fantastical realm, I want to know where its boundaries roughly lie.

daddec2f09e5d75d.voiceContent: A house can simply be a pile of wood on a plot of land, but a home cannot exist without inhabitants — the presence of people is what turns a house into a home.

9c414023d7468187.voiceContent: You've been to Port Ormos, right? Its lighthouse is a paradigm of Sumeru's architecture. I was responsible for its last round of renovations.

9d6a2c3581c6cca1.voiceContent: If only we had a place with a stable foundation and an unobstructed view... We could then experiment with builds to improve the lighthouse's structure.

4205321ba8b195dc.voiceContent: Sumeru's buildings can be divided into several primary categories. Buildings in the rainforest are mostly wooden, while those in Sumeru City and Port Ormos are generally made of stone.

b50dd845ba7ec419.voiceContent: I guess I'll share this... There was once a time in my life when I lived in abject poverty. Bankruptcy led to many a misfortune — in this world, if you don't have money, you essentially have no dignity.

6bf9d237e849628c.voiceContent: I've designed many houses for others, but a house isn't really the same thing as a home.

3377dde8d8319a47.voiceContent: Ugh... I—It's okay, I'll chalk it up to you having a unique sense of style.

3793659dd8203549.voiceContent: Look, I've been pretending that you know something about decorating, so can't you play along, too?

8cb3afc12e74bc6b.voiceContent: But I'd never try to buy this place from you, even if I had the Mora to do so. This little magical teapot must have a special place in your heart.

1472a7f0888de3bd.voiceContent: Looking at your realm, all I can think about are things like architectural composition and façade designs.

f697e9c6db3c98a6.voiceContent: Guess it's a designer's instinct? I mean, if you ask me, I think all artistic folks are kinda like this.

296972f55ec7b1a3.voiceContent: It doesn't have any extra screws or parts, and it grinds beans quickly and silently. It was a great purchase.

78554bbe97dcc38f.voiceContent: To be perfectly honest with you, my blood has been boiling with excitement ever since I first stepped foot in this realm.

0bdc4929497bc4af.voiceContent: I... Ahem! It's fine, it's fine, people have different tastes... I can't force you to like my style. Besides, some aspects of it are difficult to appreciate unless you have a certain level of understanding about aesthetics...

80d9ce26db81c55a.voiceContent: I heard that you embarked on your journey to reunite with your sibling. While I can't completely relate to your situation, the yearning for loved ones is a universal feeling.

d93ccfe0a99e609c.voiceContent: I see now... These weirdly spaced furnishings, and all the things that seemingly serve no purpose... Hm...

648ba28f61225b8b.voiceContent: Um, well... the simulation was a little questionable, but I still managed to come up with a few ideas for the tower.

ccaf3689b39ebc07.voiceContent: (Ugh, just my luck... Why does this happen to me?)

063d1509e6cc47a7.voiceContent: Why did I even bother asking... I should just keep my mouth shut.

a31c30b6747d9765.voiceContent: Uh, that actually sounds like something my Darshan would do. I've heard some of the underclassmen have quite the sense of curiosity...

e60f96fb3d749e08.voiceContent: Just need to set the timer, and... We're good!

93df30f43586d4c9.voiceContent: Everyone ready? In three, two, one...!

a1f204a4c9fb2c0b.voiceContent: Huh, I thought you'd at least want to see it. A legendary gem like that is sure to be a wonder to behold. Couldn't hurt to take a look...

e4c776e0366c2dd8.voiceContent: Um... Madame Faruzan, I think you might have had a little too much to drink...

f9a6a2cf29a32ef6.voiceContent: Here's to a successful birthday surprise!

48aa12ae45bb0042.voiceContent: You and your hermit tendencies, I swear...

f51676bd7c3d9a94.voiceContent: Huh? Is that protocol or something?

586e7310eebbb69e.voiceContent: Alright, everyone, closer together, please! People on the left, make some room!

25e6781e901cdc51.voiceContent: (Also, is it really true that I can't hold my liquor? I thought that impulsive speaking and writing were normal after a few drinks. Oh well, everyone loves to write random stuff on the message boards anyway, so...)

f32cbe05ef94e18c.voiceContent: (Alhaitham isn't thinking about revealing my secret, is he? Geez, why does he always have these horrible thoughts!? Does he really want to mess with me that much?)

b5a56beddab060a3.voiceContent: (And what he said just now... D—Does he know about my drunken scribbling?)

080cb9f4e2cd445a.voiceContent: (No... Wait, did someone tell him? Was it the people at the tavern or the liquor shop...? Why, that owner! He promised to keep this a secret!)

df68c88f0a287e90.voiceContent: Hm? Mehrak!? Where have you been!?

3fe6645d1695db1a.voiceContent: When the Dendro Archon passes by on the Flower Carriage. Once we receive the signal, we'll launch it, and... KABOOM!

ca4535fa74483f65.voiceContent: It's good I ran in to you, actually. I was hoping you could take a look at my proposal.

b4bab6779047a777.voiceContent: Yeah, Mehrak should be used to you, especially after I programmed it to recognize your voice... Something else must have happened.

1c3f7c017c084294.voiceContent: It's not like that! I just wanted to confirm the route for the Flower Carriage.

2f97547fd0c4536e.voiceContent: Speaking of a change in perspective... Maybe YOU were the one that scared Mehrak off!

4ac4082f69053766.voiceContent: Honestly, Paimon, what did you think we were doing? We were just discussing the birthday surprise.

61262286c6c89c11.voiceContent: You went to look for more coffee beans because the shop was out of stock? Hey, if they're out, they're out. You don't have to go that far...

1f21ea0644cfba3b.voiceContent: ...when... passes by on the Flower Carriage... we'll launch it...

20cfa813296dd6f6.voiceContent: You've got a point... Well, could you at least take a look at the final explosion?

b89308336ce7438a.voiceContent: Once I receive the secret signal, Mehrak will activate the mechanism from afar. That way, I can make sure the explosion goes off at the right time and place.

767a8a09aa9b7c5f.voiceContent: What? You're not involved in the Festival at all? The Akademiya couldn't convince you to help out?

cc816a2725a5624f.voiceContent: Like I said, that's not it! We have more than just a heartless, transactional relationship... You're overthinking the whole thing!

6fd317f24585a842.voiceContent: No, that's impossible... I created Mehrak myself, and I perform regular maintenance every week. There's no way Mehrak would be that heartless...

fd1fac61f79b83ac.voiceContent: I think I'm allowed some dramatics! Mehrak hasn't come back since I sent it out for coffee!

6c03c6591937f87d.voiceContent: You're saying I treat Mehrak like my inferior? I would never! I'm just worried Mehrak had some sort of awful experience and decided to run away.

cb15341ab3c3d992.voiceContent: Just trying to work through some mysteries... Oh, right! It's almost time for our meeting. We'll catch you up on the way.

ed7f16560e78f863.voiceContent: Already done! The mechanism inside the candy tower controls for those factors. The plan is completely foolproof.

c91b09e8c9c5d40b.voiceContent: Maybe something triggered an existential crisis, and Mehrak became so angry about its mechanical existence... it decided to never come back!

9d51826547dec91d.voiceContent: So, either you can predict the future and make it deviate off course, or you happened to witness the past... Yeah, the second option seems a bit easier to swallow.

8dadd61bf2d6f359.voiceContent: Yep. The candy tower I designed is going to hit the Flower Carriage at a designated time and explode into pieces, shooting candy in all directions.

0bf07c243636d5d8.voiceContent: Not the dangerous kind of explosion, though. It's supposed to look like fireworks.

3d7f3a2b2c3b0393.voiceContent: I consulted a bunch of food engineering papers, so it's completely safe. The candy is soft, and the packaging is as smooth as Silk Flower fabric.

2e6d686e2642554c.voiceContent: The ability to see the future? That's incredible...

8a46fbb080c3cf1b.voiceContent: The plans... Oh, I almost forgot! My friend has them! That guy's always causing trouble, hahaha... I'll fetch them in a bit.

7d24b9fb26c7fb5a.voiceContent: (Even though there's nothing senior about her appearance...)

4f079a64474b8f1a.voiceContent: Oh, uh... Yes! You're right. I mean, just look at the... the facade! Completely unacceptable, haha...

3eb88a87017a076e.voiceContent: The last thing we want is for the Dendro Archon to discover the surprise...

3b0c7bd1647ca02f.voiceContent: Don't worry, Archon! This is all under control!

262d47e2714591a9.voiceContent: (Madame Faruzan said she doesn't normally yell at her juniors, but I feel like I just got a glimpse of a true senior researcher...)

ee89fe963ade3290.voiceContent: Because we'd be right under the Dendro Archon's nose. It would be too easy to run into her.

c3dbec7ec0fd5b77.voiceContent: Being further away from Sumeru City means our chances of getting caught are lower.

fb77284b94ae0269.voiceContent: Of course! I'll get something to you first thing tomorrow!

4b0f4f4f0fb2a537.voiceContent: Thanks to you two, I already have a pretty good idea of how the tower should look.

10b8e21cdb37da7a.voiceContent: Thank you so much, Madame Faruzan!

fbd9e62de8012aac.voiceContent: Yes. Took me several dozen papers, but I got it in the end.

0d76e3aecc3d8715.voiceContent: What a lucky find! Bet that's made your day?

b40c9e699dbb838b.voiceContent: So many things... I never accomplished...

a0945ad179eeabfd.voiceContent: Is that the client...? Wait... Oh! It's you.

d0f895078919a168.voiceContent: The ability to appreciate beauty is an important virtue.

3b82e2ecfd7eb42f.voiceContent: It's good to get out and stretch your legs once in a while. People aren't made to stay cooped up inside all the time.

b65f80f53dfb6046.voiceContent: My latest design's getting there, but there's still room for improvement. Better make my finishing touches before the deadline creeps up...

e8196c9a0af1ea62.voiceContent: Huh? When did it start to rain? Oh no, I forgot to bring an umbrella...

90ef1e102fec4a99.voiceContent: Did you see that? That bolt of lightning was such an interesting shape!

ea9684b24ca17e56.voiceContent: This isn't my first trek into the desert, but I can never get used to the heat... *sigh* Is there no shade anywhere...?

a3f69438a2b27cc5.voiceContent: Brrr... Feels like the wind's creeping in from the back of my shirt... and also the front...

793390f98c187324.voiceContent: I get dizzy and sleepy when I'm under the sun for too long... It's a similar feeling to pulling an all-nighter on a work project.

5fc557b4dce7c050.voiceContent: Did you sleep well? I hope you have a great day today. And that you don't run into someone who ruins your day first thing in the morning.

4f596c1a51f9b78c.voiceContent: This midday sun is fierce... I should go check on the building materials I left out to dry.

b338f568a4782eda.voiceContent: There's supposed to be a great view of the stars tonight. Don't you think that's a good omen?

ffea6f6b23ca04ea.voiceContent: Relax your mind, and let go of all your troubles. Have a good night.

f533b2dabaac798d.voiceContent: It's fair to say I'm a pretty proud person when it comes to my area of expertise. Most scholars are when talking about their chosen fields. After all, we build our whole lives around it. I mean, if I ever stopped taking pride in my own work, then I would also forfeit the right to have any expectations of myself or anyone else.

7f7ed18b5da5c567.voiceContent: Aesthetic isn't the number one priority in my work, and nor should it be Quality and safety are paramount. But I never neglect the artistic side either. That's what sets my work apart from others'.

177d57e2aae679ba.voiceContent: I've always thought that you can never truly know a person until you understand their deepest wishes. But once you start exploring hopes and dreams, whether they're your own or someone else's... it can be a dangerous journey. You might unlock something that can't be put away again. Not everyone can face the potential consequences of that.

80928d33f2ae1c23.voiceContent: You must've seen the Palace of Alcazarzaray before? That's my magnum opus. I sacrificed so much for that... Everyone else thought I'd lost my mind. Haha, well, if you're not me, and you don't share my trade, I wouldn't expect you to understand. Mmm... It'd be nice to meet someone who did understand, though.

f3be15b1442a1c31.voiceContent: I almost don't want to say this out loud, but... Sometimes, hopes and dreams bring suffering instead of happiness. Luckily, I don't mind my Vision.

2c0b223498a54706.voiceContent: People who know what drives them to create deserve our respect. Wouldn't you agree?

33a7014f4de4fe58.voiceContent: The uninitiated often assume that the expertise of Kshahrewar architects starts with clay and ends with lumber. It's such an ignorant perspective that it's not even worth arguing against... If all it took to build a house was to smush a few random materials together, there'd be no need for this discipline in the first place... As well as being one of the building blocks of human culture and civilization, architecture is also an art form. Art does not exist in a vacuum, so I've always been mindful of the experiential factor for the occupants, and the emotional character conveyed to those looking on from the outside... Oh, and I'm always looking for better ways to integrate artistic expression and practical functionality.

d97287adf5e568a0.voiceContent: Lesser Lord Kusanali is a wise and capable god. Not only is she extremely knowledgeable, she also possesses virtue far beyond mortal comprehension. I have only the utmost respect for her tolerance of others — especially in a nation of learning like Sumeru, that takes great equanimity.Sometimes, though, I do stop to wonder... Surely even the gods must have their struggles, too? Oftentimes, confusion is the beginning of wisdom... In which case, how can we ever achieve true happiness?

73fa5672f0cdacaa.voiceContent: I guarantee you'll never meet anyone else who's as infuriating as him! And for the record, yes, I would say that to his face. Sure, he's smart, and sure, geniuses often come with a bad temper, but that's only half the story with him... He knows perfectly well how to appear friendly and likable to others, he just doesn't want to.If he ever gives you the impression that he doesn't really have a temper, or that he's rigidly logical like a machine, then you just don't know him well enough yet. He definitely has a personality, it's just... too big a personality. Most people wouldn't get it.

a553f479e6a5c82d.voiceContent: Alhaitham helped me out a fair amount recently. If we were still as close as we were during our student days, then I'd be thanking him every chance I got. Now, though... I can't seem to get a word of appreciation out of my mouth. Even if I could, I wouldn't want to give him the satisfaction.I guess you could say our relationship is something of a mixed bag these days? Honestly, with everything that's happened, it almost feels like the universe has been playing pranks on us... It's hard to make sense of it all... too much to process for one lifetime. I will say that it's not every day that you get to know someone like him — I just wish he could rein in some of the worst excesses of his personality. Okay, yeah, that's never gonna happen.

40674024fda901b9.voiceContent: I've met Collei quite a few times now. As Tighnari's student and assistant, she follows him everywhere. With her diligence and patience, she's much more responsible than most other kids her age. But, umm... I can also tell that she's got a lot going on inside.

860555e85484954e.voiceContent: Nilou's talent as a dancer is indisputable. Zubayr Theater really lucked out when they recruited her. I've heard that she has a great personality too — she always smiles and says encouraging things to her audience when she's performing. Once I can find some time, I'll have to catch one of her shows.

773cca551256ce20.voiceContent: Madam Faruzan doesn't mince her words, so I can understand why some students at the Akademiya are afraid of her. She doesn't have any bad intentions, though — all she wants is to devote herself completely to the research that interests her. Some people say that all Haravatat scholars are hard to get along with, and uh... heh, I'll let you be the judge of that.I assume she's already asked you to be her student? She sure is a little intense when she's doing the hard sell, huh... But she can walk the walk too. She really does know her stuff.

e5bb30089ff39c35.voiceContent: Ah, Tighnari... He's one of the nicest guys you could know. If you've met him, you'll know what I mean. He's kind, and he has enormous expertise in his field, but he never brags about it in front of other people. And he seems to genuinely care about his work.Back when I was building the Palace of Alcazarzaray, I asked him for some tips on how to pick out the right ornamental plants. After he wrote back to me, he also helped me out with some other issues, too. Oh, and I almost forgot — he was the one who first introduced me to Cyno.

2bd4e1708239f495.voiceContent: Dori is the owner of the Palace of Alcazarzaray... Excuse me? Mine? No, don't be ridiculous. I know full well that it doesn't belong to me... I know, I know, but... argh, please, let's not go there!Dori is a shrewd one. She knows how to coerce others into doing things for her. I, uh... For, ahem, various reasons, I now owe her a large sum of money. It all got quite complicated in the end, but... A—Anyway, I wish she'd show me a little mercy, and stop making my life a misery for the sake of Mora. I swear, she doesn't seem like a bad person at heart, so... I just don't understand, how did she turn out like this?

baae61a1b2bbe626.voiceContent: Cyno can come across as cold and ruthless, but he's actually a very big-hearted guy. I still remember how shocked I was when Tighnari said he was gonna introduce me to his best friend, and then a couple of seconds later, an incredibly intimidating matra comes walking through the door... I honestly never expected to meet a matra who's so comfortable hanging out with scholars. Gotta say though, I can't stand his sense of humor. It really makes my skin crawl. If he ever invites you to a meal at Tighnari's place, make sure someone's bringing beer, because no one should have to endure Cyno's humor while sober.

d209ed4fe4b7b7a0.voiceContent: You heard that I've earned myself a little fame in Sumeru? Hahaha, don't believe everything you hear. They're exaggerating, trust me. It's easy enough to make a name for yourself in Sumeru if you stick around here long enough — honestly, I think managing to keep a low profile would be more of an achievement.I hope you didn't first hear about me because of my bankruptcy scandal, though. Hmph... If you're actually willing to hear me out, I could tell you about some of my more redeeming qualities, heh...

7b495b372f645a07.voiceContent: You're not thinking about enrolling in the Akademiya, are you? ...Well, if you do sign up, from a pragmatic standpoint, I'd have to advise you to steer well clear of design. Don't get me wrong — it's a fascinating subject to study, but the work is... brutal. I spent some time working under one of my seniors after I first graduated, and they worked me to the bone every day... I was constantly being ordered around like a pack animal. I really don't know how I survived for as long as I did...

22373940ab516c7e.voiceContent: While everyone's aesthetic preferences differ to a point, beauty is, on the whole, a pretty concrete concept. I do think it's possible to establish some basic objective aesthetic standards. It's possible to improve your aesthetic appreciation, too, although it takes a lot of time to get the experience. If you ever need any advice on that front, by the way, you're always welcome to come to me.

8c8b67261f88b9ed.voiceContent: Some people think I like to stir up trouble, but they don't know what they're talking about. Anyone trying to make any sort of progress in life is inevitably gonna come into conflict with other people from time to time. You can't just ignore the situation because you don't wanna deal with it.

210d4d2f00cf6e5c.voiceContent: I like to have a drink or two when I've got the time — it's a good way to de-stress. Hm? Oh, yeah, I mean, mostly just to pass the time, heh.Uh... Ahem, what's that look for...? Alright, alright! I admit it! Maybe I do drown my sorrows a little more often that I was letting on. It all gets a bit too much sometimes, what with the unfinished projects, obstacles that I can't overcome, misunderstandings with other people... Don't you struggle with those kinds of things as well?

1301c9303c6c4944.voiceContent: Music, architecture, sculpting, painting... All are worth taking the time to appreciate properly.I wouldn't say I'm an expert in all of them, but as long as I stay interested, maybe I can master them all one day. I mean, look — I already know how to play an instrument.

8da1e3df6be125d9.voiceContent: My troubles? ...Hmm, the most obvious one would be my financial situation.It's not that I can't make Mora, it's just that I can't seem to hold on to it. So many things in life require money, and if you're not careful, it just disappears... Don't worry about me, though — I'm a lot better than I used to be. I'll be more careful to live within my means in the future.

bb8f847fb81a12d9.voiceContent: I can't deal with anything that's too hot or spicy. If I have to eat them, I leave them to cool first so I at least don't burn my tongue.

881e185e93469e58.voiceContent: This is marvelous! Can you teach me how to make it?

d1770fc09b228b52.voiceContent: I bet this'd go great with a glass of wine!

7f80b4733e29cbbb.voiceContent: Is it your birthday today? Well, congratulations! Birthdays are important days, and it's also one of those days in the year that gets you thinking about your family. However you spend today, I hope it makes you happy.

ebc6a8dc7f16dc7c.voiceContent: Hmm? Got any more where that came from?

5744c2d39dd0270d.voiceContent: My horizons have been broadened... I hope I can hold on to this feeling.

983314ebb599841e.voiceContent: The more power I wield, the more things I can accomplish. Even if achieving my goals comes at a cost, and even if all my hopes and dreams are built on pain and suffering... I don't want to turn back now.

121f48f20fdaa58d.voiceContent: My favorites are alcohol, warm soup, and anything with cream or cheese in it. Oh, and I'll never say no to fresh fruit.

60dc0f70a63760fe.voiceContent: I'm glad you gave me a chance. I always think it takes people with similar tastes to sustain a pleasant conversation.Nice to meet you — I'm Kaveh, an architect. If you have a project you'd like me to work on, then I'll need a detailed description of what you have in mind.

20d9e17707dab6b0.voiceContent: Haha, things are finally looking up!

a16d4f5d19f8d617.voiceContent: That'll be the first and last!
